intro.title: What is ProcureData?
intro.content:
ProcureData is a Data Space for the Procurement Function (Procurement Data Space).

It is a digital infrastructure designed to facilitate the sharing of value-added data between companies, following European standards of sovereignty, transparency and security.

It is not a centralized database, but a decentralized ecosystem where each organization maintains control over its information.

quiz.question: What type of infrastructure is ProcureData?

problema.title: The nxm Problem
problema.currentDesc: Each supplier (n) must repeat their onboarding, certification and compliance processes for each new client (m).
problema.solutionDesc: A supplier is validated only once. Their "Digital Passport" is shared instantly.

quiz.question: What problem does the nxm model solve?
options: Redundancy in validation processes between suppliers and clients

roles.title: Ecosystem Roles
roles.intro: The Trust Triangle defines three main actors:

consumer.subtitle: Buyer
consumer.description: The entity (usually the buyer) that requests access to specific data to validate a supplier or analyze risks.

provider.subtitle: Supplier/Subject
provider.description: The original data owner. They exercise sovereignty, authorizing or denying who can see their information.

dataHolder.subtitle: Custodian
dataHolder.description: The technical entity (such as certification agencies or ERPs) that physically holds the verified data and delivers it securely.

flujo.title: Operational Flow: From Registration to Transaction
flujo.intro: Technical process to complete a sovereign data exchange:

steps.title: Registration and KYB Validation
steps.desc: The company registers and provides legal documentation. Know Your Business process is performed.

steps.title: Wallet Configuration
steps.desc: A unique DID address is assigned and EUROe balance is loaded.

steps.title: Marketplace Search
steps.desc: Search for suppliers using filters by sector, ISO certifications or badges.

steps.title: Access Request
steps.desc: The buyer requests the Digital Passport. Funds are locked in Escrow.

steps.title: Supplier Approval
steps.desc: The owner authorizes the exchange based on the ODRL policy.

steps.title: Delivery and Notarization
steps.desc: The Data Holder releases the information. Hash is generated in blockchain.

quiz.question: What happens when the buyer requests a Digital Passport?
options: An email is sent to the supplier
Funds are locked in an Escrow contract
